graph.drawing

Interface CoordinateFinderInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BarycentricCoordinateFinder, FRCoordinateFinder, RandomCoordinateFinder

    public interface CoordinateFinderInterface
extends java.lang.Runnable
    This interface defines the interface for finding the proper coordinates for the nodes in the graph, prior to display.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void findCoordinates()
      Finds the coordinates for the vertices in the graph.
      double getProgress()
      Gets the current progress of the calculations.
      void setAutoJGUpdate(boolean autoUpdateFlag)
      Whether to automatically updated the associated JGraph object.
      void stop()
      Stops the process of finding the coordinates.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable

        run

    • Method Detail

        Whether to automatically updated the associated JGraph object.

        autoUpdateFlag - Boolean flag determining the automatic JGraph update.

                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Finds the coordinates for the vertices in the graph.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the process of finding the coordinates.

      • getProgress

        double getProgress()
        Gets the current progress of the calculations.
        Returns:
        Double that is the percentage of work done on calculating the coordinates.
